isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - REAR HOOD GUIDE SUPPORT

svcsubproc.title: 9300 and 9400 (After June 1994) Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment In or Out
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 94 for all Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.
To adjust the side of the hood in or out at the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to align the side of the hood with the side of the cab (Item 5), use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender extension/skirt (Item 2), loosen the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3) holding the bottom of the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to the hood guide support bracket (Item 4).
Push the bottom of the hood guide support (Item 1) in or out, as required, until the rear edge of the hood is even with the side of the cab (Item 5).

With the rear edge of the hood even with the side of the cab (Item 5), hold the rear hood guide support (Item 1) in place on the hood guide support bracket (Item 4) and tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3).
Repeat this procedure for the other side of the vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment In or Out
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for all Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.
To adjust the side of the hood in or out at the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to align the side of the hood with the side of the cab, use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2), loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3) holding the hood guide support (Item 1) to the hood guide support bracket (Item 4).
Push the hood guide support (Item 1) in or out, as required, until the rear edge of the hood is even with the side of the cab.

With the rear edge of the hood even with the side of the cab, hold the rear hood guide support (Item 1) in place on the hood guide support bracket (Item 4) and tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3).
Repeat this procedure for the other side of the vehicle.

figure.caption: Figure 95. 9100, 9200, 9400 Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment Up or Down
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for all Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.
To adjust the side of the hood up or down at the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to align the top of the hood with the top of the cab cowl, use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 5) at the front of the mounting bracket (Item 6).

Reach under the fender and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2), and run the adjusting bolt (Item 7) up or down to raise or lower the hood guide support (Item 1) so the top of the hood is at the same height as the cab cowl.
Once the hood and cab cowl are at the same height, tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 5).

It may be necessary to adjust the rear hood guide up or down along with adjusting the rear hood guide support to make the hood and cowl the same height. Refer to 9200 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Rear Hood Guide Adjustment Up or Down, or 9300 and 9400 (After June 1994) - Rear Hood Guide Adjustment Up or Down.
Repeat this procedure for the other side of the vehicle.
